quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the game of baseball and its history!

questions.question: How many players are there on the field for a single team during a standard baseball game?
questions.explanation: A standard baseball game consists of 9 players on the field for each team. These positions include pitcher, catcher, infielders, and outfielders.

questions.question: Which team holds the record for the most World Series championships in Major League Baseball (MLB) history?
questions.explanation: The New York Yankees hold the record for the most World Series championships in MLB history, with 27 titles.

questions.question: In baseball, a 'perfect game' refers to what achievement?
options: Scoring a run in every inning
No hits, walks, or errors by the opposing team
Winning the game by a large margin
Hitting a home run in every at-bat
questions.answer: No hits, walks, or errors by the opposing team
questions.explanation: A 'perfect game' in baseball refers to a game in which a pitcher allows no hits, walks, or errors by the opposing team throughout the entire game.

questions.question: Which legendary baseball player broke the color barrier in Major League Baseball in 1947?
questions.explanation: Jackie Robinson is the legendary baseball player who broke the color barrier in MLB in 1947, becoming the first African American to play in the modern era of the league.

questions.question: How many strikes are needed to record a strikeout for a pitcher?
questions.explanation: A pitcher needs to record three strikes against a batter to achieve a strikeout. A strike is called when a batter swings and misses at a pitch or when the pitch crosses the plate within the strike zone and is not swung at.

questions.question: Which baseball player holds the record for the most career home runs in MLB history?
questions.explanation: Barry Bonds holds the record for the most career home runs in MLB history, with 762 home runs.

questions.question: Which MLB team's home games are played at Dodger Stadium?
questions.explanation: The Los Angeles Dodgers play their home games at Dodger Stadium, located in Los Angeles, California.

questions.question: What is the term used in baseball when a player hits a home run with all bases occupied?
questions.explanation: In baseball, a 'Grand Slam' refers to a home run hit with all three bases occupied by baserunners, resulting in four runs scoring on a single play.

questions.question: Which MLB team is known as the 'Bronx Bombers'?
questions.explanation: The New York Yankees are known as the 'Bronx Bombers' due to their historically powerful lineup and strong hitting performances.

questions.question: Which baseball statistic is used to measure a player's batting average?
questions.explanation: BA stands for 'Batting Average', and it is used to measure a player's hitting performance by calculating the ratio of hits to at-bats.
